official_title: A bill to affirm the authority of the Congress to approve the design of currency.

summary.text: (Measure passed House, amended) Currency Design Act - Amends the Federal Reserve Act to prohibit the Secretary of the Treasury from adopting any new form, tenor, or design of any Federal reserve note after June 1, 1985, unless: (1) the proposal for such adoption has been submitted to each House of the Congress; and (2) 90 days have passed since the second House received the proposal.

titles.title: A bill to affirm the authority of the Congress to approve the design of currency.
